triples.name: Safety-critical system
triples.relevance: Safety-critical systems are the foundation for understanding the control and safety guarantees discussed throughout the paper.

triples.name: Autonomous robot
triples.relevance: Autonomous robots are the primary application domain for the safety filter approaches reviewed in the paper.

triples.name: Robotics
triples.relevance: Robotics is the broader field providing the technological context and practical challenges motivating the safety filter framework.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory underpins the model-based safe control methods and provides fundamental concepts for the paper's safety filter framework.

triples.name: Data-driven model
triples.relevance: Data-driven models represent the emerging approaches that the paper integrates with traditional methods through the unified safety filter framework.

triples.name: Machine learning control
triples.relevance: Machine learning control techniques are key data-driven approaches that the safety filter framework aims to make safer and more reliable.

triples.name: Verification and validation
triples.relevance: Verification and validation are essential for ensuring that autonomous systems meet safety requirements, a core concern of the paper.

triples.name: Barrier function
triples.relevance: The safety filter framework uses barrier functions as a core mathematical concept to constrain autonomous systems within safe regions.
